definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail

sentences.english: The children were ey(e)ing the sweets.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们正眼巴巴地盯着糖果。

sentences.english: On the following Monday you saw that the directors passedthe dividend.That was the reason.
sentences.chinese: 之后的周一你眼巴巴看着董事们分红，而这才是原因。

sentences.english: His heirs were greedily waiting for him to kick the bucket.
sentences.chinese: 他的继承人正眼巴巴地盼着他死呢。

sentences.english: Thatwas  the fact. On the following Monday you saw that the directors passedthe dividend.
sentences.chinese: 之后的周一你眼巴巴看着董事们分红，而这才是原因。

sentences.english: The little girl is obedient did not speak, looks at the officers and soldiers eagerly.
sentences.chinese: 小女孩听话地不讲话了，眼巴巴地看着官兵们。

definition: to stare blankly/to look on helplessly/to look on unfeelingly
unable to take one's eyes off (idiom); to gaze steadily/to stare
